article_title: Wage reform needed, but should be phased in
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox.

article_metadata.description: More than 4 million U.S. workers will become eligible by Dec. 1 for overtime pay, and an additional 7.6 million could also benefit, under rules issued last week by the Obama administration.On the one hand it seems like a good thing for American middle- and low-income workers whose wages have stagnated for years. On the other hand, businesses have reason to be concerned.Under the new rules, released in draft form last summer, the annual salary threshold at which companies can deny overtime pay
